title: Julia Restoin Roitfeld on how to create a fashion uniform that flatters your shape
text:
There are many in the fashion world who stick to a ‘uniform’ when getting dressed. Anna Wintour, the American Vogue editor, is famously a fan of an A-line midi dress, a triple stack of antique crystal necklaces, and Manolo Blahnik’s Botti heels. Donatella Versace always wears a power minidress and skyscraper stilettos.

For some, the thought of dressing to any sort of formula feels like a heavy commitment. But if done right, employing the principles can help anyone to cut their getting-dressed time in half, and ensure that whatever you put on in a rush in the morning is a) flattering for your figure and b) goes together effortlessly. Even if you only revert to your uniform as your fall back option....
